items.name: A single character of: a, b or c
items.description: Matches either an a, b or c character

items.name: A character except: a, b or c
items.description: Matches any character except for an a, b or c

items.name: A character in the range: a-z
items.description: Matches any characters between a and z, including a and z.

items.name: A character not in the range: a-z
items.description: Matches any characters except those in the range a-z.

items.name: A character in the range: a-z or A-Z
items.description: Matches any characters between a-z or A-Z. You can combine as much as you please.

items.name: Any single character
items.description: Matches any character other than newline (or including newline with the /s flag)

items.name: Any whitespace character
items.description: Matches any space, tab or newline character.

items.name: Any non-whitespace character
items.description: Matches anything other than a space, tab or newline.

items.name: Any digit
items.description: Matches any decimal digit. Equivalent to [0-9].

items.name: Any non-digit
items.description: Matches anything other than a decimal digit.

items.name: Any word character
items.description: Matches any letter, digit or underscore. Equivalent to [a-zA-Z0-9_].

items.name: Any non-word character
items.description: Matches anything other than a letter, digit or underscore.

items.name: Capture everything enclosed
items.description: Parts of the regex enclosed in parentheses may be referred to later in the expression or extracted from the results of a successful match.

items.name: Match either a or b
items.description: Matches the a or the b part of the subexpression.

items.name: Zero or one of a
items.description: Matches an `a` character or nothing.

items.name: Zero or more of a
items.description: Matches zero or more consecutive `a` characters.

example.text: a ba baa aaa ba b

items.name: One or more of a
items.description: Matches one or more consecutive `a` characters.

example.text: a aa aaa aaaa bab baab

items.name: Exactly 3 of a
items.description: Matches exactly 3 consecutive `a` characters.

items.name: 3 or more of a
items.description: Matches at least 3 consecutive `a` characters.

items.name: Between 3 and 6 of a
items.description: Matches between 3 and 6 (inclusive) consecutive `a` characters.

items.name: Start of string
items.description: Matches the start of a string without consuming any characters. If multiline mode is used, this will also match immediately after a newline character.

items.name: End of string
items.description: Matches the end of a string without consuming any characters. If multiline mode is used, this will also match immediately before a newline character.

items.name: A word boundary
items.description: Matches, without consuming any characters, immediately between a character matched by \w and a character not matched by \w (in either order). It cannot be used to separate non words from words.

items.name: Non-word boundary
items.description: Matches, without consuming any characters, at the position between two characters matched by \w.

items.name: Newline
items.description: Matches a newline character

items.name: Carriage return
items.description: Matches a carriage return character, unicode character 2185.

items.name: Tab
items.description: Matches a tab character. Historically, tab stops happen every 8 characters.

items.name: Null character
items.description: Matches a null character, most often visually represented in unicode using U+2400.

items.name: Start of string
items.description: Matches the start of a string without consuming any characters. If multiline mode is used, this will also match immediately after a newline character.

items.name: End of string
items.description: Matches the end of a string without consuming any characters. If multiline mode is used, this will also match immediately before a newline character.

items.name: A word boundary
items.description: Matches, without consuming any characters, immediately between a character matched by \w and a character not matched by \w (in either order). It cannot be used to separate non words from words.

items.name: Non-word boundary
items.description: Matches, without consuming any characters, at the position between two characters matched by \w.

items.name: Any single character
items.description: Matches any character other than newline (or including newline with the /s flag)

items.name: Any whitespace character
items.description: Matches any space, tab or newline character.

items.name: Any non-whitespace character
items.description: Matches anything other than a space, tab or newline.

items.name: Any digit
items.description: Matches any decimal digit. Equivalent to [0-9].

items.name: Any non-digit
items.description: Matches anything other than a decimal digit.

items.name: Any word character
items.description: Matches any letter, digit or underscore. Equivalent to [a-zA-Z0-9_].

items.name: Any non-word character
items.description: Matches anything other than a letter, digit or underscore.

items.name: Vertical whitespace character
items.description: Matches newlines and vertical tabs. Works with Unicode. Vertical tabs can be inserted in some word processors using CMD/CTRL+ENTER.

items.name: Match nth subpattern
items.description: Usually referred to as a `backreference`, this will match a repeat of the text captured in a previous set of parentheses. To reduce ambiguity one may also use `\gn`, or `\g{n}` where n is a digit.

items.name: Match subpattern `name`
items.description: Matches the text matched by a previously named capture group. Please note this feature is experimental in JavaScript and might not be supported by your browser.

items.name: Hex character YYYY
items.description: Matches the unicode character with the given hex value. Unicode Character Table

items.name: Hex character YY
items.description: Matches the 8-bit character with the given hex value. Unicode Character Table

items.name: Octal character ddd
items.description: Matches the 8-bit character with the given octal value. Octal Character Table

items.name: Control character Y
items.description: Matches ASCII characters typically associated with Control+A through Control+Z: \x01 through \x1A. ASCII control characters

items.name: Backspace character
items.description: Matches the backspace control character.

items.name: Makes any character literal
items.description: This may be used to match the literal value of any metacharacter, or the / delimiter.

items.name: Zero or one of a
items.description: Matches an `a` character or nothing.

items.name: Zero or more of a
items.description: Matches zero or more consecutive `a` characters.

example.text: a ba baa aaa ba b

items.name: One or more of a
items.description: Matches one or more consecutive `a` characters.

example.text: a aa aaa aaaa bab baab

items.name: Exactly 3 of a
items.description: Matches exactly 3 consecutive `a` characters.

items.name: 3 or more of a
items.description: Matches at least 3 consecutive `a` characters.

items.name: Between 3 and 6 of a
items.description: Matches between 3 and 6 (inclusive) consecutive `a` characters.

items.name: Greedy quantifier
items.description: Matches as many characters as possible.

example.text: greedy can be dangerous at times

items.name: Lazy quantifier
items.description: Matches as few characters as possible.

items.name: Capture everything enclosed
items.description: Parts of the regex enclosed in parentheses may be referred to later in the expression or extracted from the results of a successful match.

items.name: Match either a or b
items.description: Matches the a or the b part of the subexpression.

items.name: Match everything enclosed
items.description: This construct is similar to (...), but won't create a capture group.

items.name: Named Capturing Group
items.description:
This capturing group can be referred to using the given name instead of a number.
Please note this feature is experimental in JavaScript and might not be supported by your browser.

items.name: Positive Lookahead
items.description: Asserts that the given subpattern can be matched here, without consuming characters

items.name: Negative Lookahead
items.description: Starting at the current position in the expression, ensures that the given pattern will not match. Does not consume characters.

items.name: Positive Lookbehind
items.description: Ensures that the given pattern will match, ending at the current position in the expression. The pattern be of variable width. Does not consume any characters. Note that this feature is not yet supported on all browsers; use at your own discretion!

items.name: Negative Lookbehind
items.description:
Ensures that the given pattern would not match and end at the current position in the expression. The pattern be of variable width. Does not consume characters.
Note that this feature is not yet supported on all browsers; use at your own discretion!

items.name: A single character of: a, b or c
items.description: Matches either an a, b or c character

items.name: A character except: a, b or c
items.description: Matches any character except for an a, b or c

items.name: A character in the range: a-z
items.description: Matches any characters between a and z, including a and z.

items.name: A character not in the range: a-z
items.description: Matches any characters except those in the range a-z.

items.name: A character in the range: a-z or A-Z
items.description: Matches any characters between a-z or A-Z. You can combine as much as you please.

items.name: Global
items.description: Tells the engine not to stop after the first match has been found, but rather to continue until no more matches can be found.

items.name: Multiline
items.description: The ^ and $ anchors now match at the beginning/end of each line respectively, instead of beginning/end of the entire string.

items.name: Case insensitive
items.description: A case insensitive match is performed, meaning capital letters will be matched by non-capital letters and vice versa.

items.name: Sticky - searches in strings only from the index of the last match
items.description:
Regex will continue parsing the string keeping in mind the last match location. If the next match is not located directly after the last, this next match is discarded.
In the example below, the first alternate matched "a", and the second one matched "bc", however once it bumped into "X" none of the alternatives resulted in a match. Therefore the engine cannot return the next "a" as a match because "X" is not the last location where a match occurred.

items.name: Enable unicode support
items.description: Allows regex to match unicode characters via dotall and unicode escape sequences, as well as ES6 unicode code point escapes such as \u{1D306}.

items.name: Contents in capture group 1
items.description: This will return a string with the contents from the first capture group. The number, in this case 1, can be any number as long as it corresponds to a valid capture group.

items.name: Contents before match
items.description: This will return a portion of the source string that precedes the match.

items.name: Contents after match
items.description: This will return a portion of the source string that follows the match.

items.name: Complete match contents
items.description: This will return a string with the complete match result from the regex.

items.name: Hexadecimal replacement values
items.description: You can use hexadecimals to insert any character into the replacement string using the standard syntax.

items.name: Hexadecimal replacement values
items.description: You can use hexadecimals to insert any character into the replacement string using the standard syntax.

items.name: Tab
items.description: Insert a tab character.

items.name: Carriage return
items.description: Insert a carriage return character.

items.name: Newline
items.description: Insert a newline character.

items.name: Form-feed
items.description: Insert a form-feed character.
